docs.abstract: The former senator has been an advocate for better nutrition for more than half a century.
docs.snippet: The former senator has been an advocate for better nutrition for more than half a century.

docs.abstract: The former senator has been an advocate for better nutrition for more than half a century.
docs.lead_paragraph: George McGovern's impact on food policy could have been greater, but not through more effort on his part. The 1972 presidential candidate, now 89, was a bomber pilot at the end of World War II when the decision was made to distribute remaining medicine and food to Europeans before heading home. "We were feeding our former enemies two days after bombing them," he told me over breakfast last week, two days before falling and being hospitalized. "It was an unprecedented gesture of good will."
docs.snippet: The former senator has been an advocate for better nutrition for more than half a century.

headline.print_headline: Don’t Just Sit There, Work Out At Your Desk
headline.main: Don’t Just Sit There, Work Out at Your Desk

docs.abstract: Eric V Copage Workstation column points out that sitting for long periods is not good for one's health, so some companies are giving employees a chance to exercise while working — with innovations like treadmills attached to desks.
docs.lead_paragraph: Sitting for long periods isn’t good for your health, so some companies are giving employees a chance to exercise while working — with innovations like treadmills attached to desks.
docs.snippet: Sitting for long periods isn’t good for your health, so some companies are giving employees a chance to exercise while working — with innovations like treadmills attached to desks.

headline.seo: Chelsea Clinton, Living Up to the Family Name
headline.print_headline: Living Up To the Family Name
headline.main: Chelsea Clinton, Living Up to the Family Name

docs.abstract: Chelsea Clinton, who avoided the public eye for many years, seems to have finally accepted her celebrity as she takes on a high-profile job at NBC News as a special correspondent.
docs.lead_paragraph: A job with NBC is the latest step in Chelsea Clinton’s gradual coming out as a public figure, one who seems to be finally accepting her celebrity.
docs.snippet: A job with NBC is the latest step in Chelsea Clinton’s gradual coming out as a public figure, one who seems to be finally accepting her celebrity.

docs.abstract: Carl Zimmer Gray Matter column examines the host of ethical questions and dilemmas presented by new research in microbiology and on bacteria.
docs.lead_paragraph: Who owns the bacteria swimming through your body: you, or the researcher who discovers it?
docs.snippet: Who owns the bacteria swimming through your body: you, or the researcher who discovers it?

headline.main: The Bronx Savors Its Second-Place Marathoner

docs.abstract: A celebration for a Bronx resident who did the borough proud on a big stage.
docs.snippet: A celebration for a Bronx resident who did the borough proud on a big stage.

headline.main: The Bronx Savors Its Second-Place Marathoner

docs.abstract: A celebration for a Bronx resident who did the borough proud on a big stage.
docs.lead_paragraph: Buzunesh Deba enjoyed the South Bronx on Friday at a lot more leisurely pace than the last time she was there. Granted, that was during the New York City Marathon, where she was on the way to a second-place finish among the elite women. This time, she was savoring the praise and love of students and fans at a luncheon in her honor at Hostos Community College.
docs.snippet: A celebration for a Bronx resident who did the borough proud on a big stage.

headline.seo: Toys to Cost Extra in San Francisco Happy Meals
headline.print_headline: For a Dime, McDonald’s Beats a Toy Ban
headline.main: Toys Stay in San Francisco Happy Meals, for a Charge

docs.abstract: McDonald's will charge 10 cents for toys contained in its Happy Meals in its San Francisco restaurants; charge gets around city ordinance banning free toys with fast-food meals.
docs.lead_paragraph: When a city ordinance banning free toys with fast-food meals goes into effect on Thursday, parents buying Happy Meals at McDonald’s can still get toys, for an extra 10 cents.
docs.snippet: When a city ordinance banning free toys with fast-food meals goes into effect on Thursday, parents buying Happy Meals at McDonald’s can still get toys, for an extra 10 cents.
